statements: SELECT customer_name, email_address FROM CustomerContacts
SELECT * FROM CustomerContacts
SELECT customer_name, phone_number FROM CustomerContacts WHERE customer_id = 1
SELECT email_address, address FROM CustomerContacts WHERE customer_name LIKE 'ABC%'
SELECT * FROM CustomerContacts ORDER BY customer_id DESC
SELECT customer_name, email_address FROM CustomerContacts WHERE customer_id = 1
SELECT * FROM CustomerContacts WHERE email_address LIKE '%gmail.com'
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, address FROM CustomerContacts ORDER BY customer_name DESC, customer_id ASC
SELECT customer_name, phone_number FROM CustomerContacts WHERE customer_name LIKE 'J%' OR address LIKE '%Street'
SELECT customer_name, address, phone_number FROM CustomerContacts WHERE phone_number IS NOT NULL
SELECT * FROM CustomerContacts;
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM CustomerContacts WHERE id = 1;
SELECT id, first_name, last_name, phone_number FROM CustomerContacts ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM InteractionLogs WHERE interaction_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31';
SELECT log_id, customer_id, interaction_date, LEFT(interaction_notes, 50) AS shortened_notes FROM InteractionLogs ORDER BY interaction_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM CustomerContacts WHERE id = 1;
SELECT first_name, last_name, phone_number FROM CustomerContacts ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM CustomerContacts WHERE email LIKE '%@example.com';
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_count FROM CustomerContacts;
SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, i.interaction_date, i.interaction_notes FROM CustomerContacts c JOIN InteractionLogs i ON c.id = i.customer_id;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, first_name, phone_number FROM customers ORDER BY customer_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM addresses WHERE city='New York';
SELECT order_id, order_date, total_amount FROM orders WHERE status='Delivered';
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM customers WHERE email LIKE '%gmail.com%';

SELECT orders.order_id, orders.total_amount, customers.first_name, addresses.city FROM orders JOIN customers ON orders.customer_id = customers.customer_id JOIN addresses ON customers.customer_id = addresses.customer_id WHERE orders.total_amount > 1000;

SELECT customers.first_name, customers.last_name, addresses.street_address, addresses.city, addresses.state, addresses.postal_code FROM customers JOIN addresses ON customers.customer_id = addresses.customer_id WHERE customers.first_name = 'Alice';

SELECT orders.order_id, orders.order_date, orders.total_amount, orders.status, customers.first_name, addresses.city FROM orders JOIN customers ON orders.customer_id = customers.customer_id JOIN addresses ON customers.customer_id = addresses.customer_id WHERE orders.order_date >= '2022-01-01' AND orders.status = 'Completed';
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT order_id, total_amount, order_date FROM orders ORDER BY order_date DESC;
SELECT customer_id, street_address, city, state, postal_code FROM addresses WHERE postal_code LIKE '94%';
SELECT interaction_id, interaction_date, interaction_details FROM interactions WHERE customer_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 2;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(order_id) AS order_count FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id ORDER BY order_count DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers INNER JOIN addresses ON customers.customer_id = addresses.customer_id;
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, EXTRACT(YEAR FROM interaction_date) AS interaction_year FROM interactions ORDER BY interaction_year DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT product_name, price FROM products ORDER BY price DESC;
SELECT order_id, total_amount FROM orders WHERE total_amount > 1000;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(*) AS num_orders FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id HAVING num_orders > 3;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT first_name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT product_name, price FROM products ORDER BY price DESC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, city, state FROM customers INNER JOIN addresses ON customers.customer_id = addresses.customer_id;
SELECT order_id, total_amount FROM orders WHERE total_amount > 100 ORDER BY order_date ASC;
